english_translation: Chapter: Currency exchange in weighing and measuring

Narrated by Ali: A gift of dates was presented to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He did not refuse any of it and said to Bilal: 'Take care of these dates until I ask you about them.' Bilal went and exchanged the dates giving two and taking one. When it was the next day, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Bring us what we hid with you.' When Bilal brought the dates, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ asked him: 'What is this that we hid with you?' So Bilal informed him of what he had done. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: 'This is forbidden that which is not proper to eat. Go and return it to its owner and command him not to sell like this nor buy like this.' Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Gold for gold like for like, silver for silver like for like, wheat for wheat like for like, corn for corn like for like, barley for barley like for like hand to hand, so whoever gives more or takes more has committed riba.' And Zayd ibn Ali said: When the two types differ from what is measured, there is no harm in giving two for one like for like hand to hand and deferment is not allowed. When the two types differ from what is weighed, there is no harm in giving two for one like for like hand to hand and deferment is not allowed. When the two types differ from what is neither measured nor weighed, there is no harm in giving two for one like for like hand to hand and deferment is allowed.

english_translation: Chapter: Mark-up selling

Narrated by Ali: Whoever lies in a mark-up sale, he has betrayed Allah and His Messenger and the believers, and Allah will resurrect him on the Day of Judgment in the company of the hypocrites. And Zayd ibn Ali said: There is no harm in mark-up selling if you clarify the cost price, and there is no harm in selling at marked-up prices. These are Persian words, so do not worry about which language it is. And I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who purchases merchandise and it is altered in his possession. He disliked him selling it as mark-up until he clarifies.

english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade the sale of wine, and pigs, and filth, and said: They are carrion, and forbade eating the price of any of those, and forbade selling charity until it is received, and forbade selling the fifth until it is divided. Abu Khalid said: Zayd ibn Ali explained to us two conditions in a sale, that you say I sold you this commodity on the condition that it is cash at this price or on credit at this price or on the condition that it is at this time for this price and at another time for this price. Or regarding credit with sale, that you lend something and then sell it before you receive it. And regarding selling what is not with you, that you sell the commodity and then buy it after that and deliver it to the one you sold it to. And profit of what is not guaranteed, that a man buys merchandise and then sells it before he receives it and gives the other some of the profit. And selling what has not been received, that a man buys merchandise and then sells it before he receives it. And touching sale: a sale that was in the time of ignorance where two men negotiate over merchandise, so whichever one of them touched the other, the sale became binding and he could not return. And throwing sale: when two men negotiate so whichever one threw it to his companion, the sale became binding. And pebble sale: when two men negotiate, so whichever one threw a pebble, the sale became binding. And hazard sale: selling fish in the water and milk in the udder, and these are sales that were in the time of ignorance.

english_translation: Chapter: Option in sales

Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Whoever buys an animal with accumulated milk, he has option in it for three days. If he is satisfied with it, then good, otherwise he returns it and returns with it a measure of dates. And whoever buys a full-uddered animal, he has the option in it for three days. If he is satisfied with it otherwise he returns it and returns with it a measure of dates. Abu Khalid said: Zayd ibn Ali explained to us the misrepresented camel and the full-uddered sheep, which is the one whose milk is left for days.

english_translation: Narrated by Ali: That the Messenger of Allah ﷺ gave warranty for slaves for three days. And Zayd ibn Ali said: The option shall not exceed three days. And Imam Zayd ibn Ali said: Whoever buys something and has not seen it, he has the option when he sees it; if he wishes he takes it and if he wishes he leaves it. And Zayd ibn Ali said: The option is not nullified except if he says with his tongue I am satisfied, or he has intercourse with her. If he eats, or touches, or rides, he has the option.

english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: The two sellers have the option in what they have sold until they separate in contentment. I asked Zayd about separation by bodies or by words. He said: Rather by words. Only he who does not know the Arabic language says separation by bodies. Do you not see the saying of Allah: And do not be like those who separated and differed after clear proofs came to them, they only separated by words even though their bodies were gathered. And He said: Indeed those who split their religion and became sects, you are not of them in anything, they only separated from their religion by words.

english_translation: Chapter: Sales with specific terms

Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Sales with unknown terms is not permissible. And Zayd ibn Ali said: Sales are not permissible to Nowruz, and to Mihraj, and not to Christian fasting, and not to their breaking of fast, and sales are not permissible to stipend, and not to harvest, and not to threshing, and not to date picking, and not to fruit picking, and not to grape pressing. And there is no harm in sales to Fitr, and to Adha, and to the season, and to a known term among Muslims, so sales to this term is permissible.

english_translation: Chapter: Betrayal in sales

Narrated by Ali, regarding His statement: Do not betray Allah and the Messenger and betray your trusts while you know. He said: Among betrayal is lying in buying and selling. I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who bought from a man something on mark-up and then discovered that the seller deceived him. He said: The deception is reduced from the buyer but nothing is reduced from him of the profit. And I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who bought merchandise and shortened it, or dyed it, or twisted it, then wanted to sell it on mark-up and add to its price what he spent on it. He said: He should not sell that until he clarifies. And I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who bought merchandise at a term, then sold it on mark-up while the buyer did not know that he bought it at a term, then knew after that. He said: He has the option, if he wishes he takes and if he wishes he leaves.

english_translation: Narrated by Ali: About a man who bought a slave girl and then had intercourse with her and then found a defect in her, the buyer kept her and the seller was judged to pay one-tenth of the price. And I asked Zayd ibn Ali what is the meaning of this? He said: The reduction for the defect was one-tenth. And I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who bought a slave girl and found her to be pregnant. He said: He returns her. I said: If he did not return her until she gave birth to a living or dead child? He said: If the child is alive, if its value equals the reduction for pregnancy or more, he does not return anything, and if it is less he returns the full reduction for pregnancy. And if the child is dead, he returns the full reduction for pregnancy. I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who buys a slave girl and finds her to be a runaway, or insane, or urinating on the bed. He said: This is a defect so he returns her. I said: If he presented her for sale? He said: This is not satisfaction. And if he had intercourse with her as if satisfied, or says with his tongue I have accepted her, he said: And if he accepted her for lust, this was not satisfaction. I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who bought cloth and cut it into a shirt and sewed it, then found a defect in it. He said: If he did this while knowing, this was satisfaction, and if he did this while not knowing then knew, he returns the reduction for the defect. I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who bought merchandise and sold it, then discovered a defect. He said: He returns the reduction of the defect because the seller did not fulfill his condition.

english_translation: Chapter: Sale of fruits

Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade the sale of full-uddered animals and mixed date sale, and forbade the sale of trees until they solidify, and forbade the sale of fruit until it ripens, meaning until it yellows or reddens. Imam Zayd ibn Ali said: The mixed date sale is the sale of dates for dates, and mixing crops sale is the sale of crops for wheat, and ripening is yellowing and reddening. I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who buys fruit before it ripens on the condition that he cuts it. He said: There is no harm in that. I said: If he buys it before it ripens on the condition that he leaves it until it ripens? He said: This is not permissible and does not occur.

english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Whoever sells a date palm with fruit in it, the fruit belongs to the seller unless the buyer stipulates. And whoever buys a slave who has money, the money belongs to the seller unless the buyer stipulates. And whoever buys a field with crops in it, the crops belong to the seller unless the buyer stipulates. I asked Zayd ibn Ali about selling grapes to one who presses it into wine. He said: I dislike that. And I asked Zayd ibn Ali about a man who bought the fruit of an orchard and the seller excluded the fruit of a date palm that was not known. He said: This sale is not permissible. And Zayd ibn Ali said: My father informed me, from my grandfather, from Ali, that two men disputed before him, one of them said: I sold you this females and excepted five females I did not know them, and I have the option. He said: The transaction between you is corrupt.

english_translation: Chapter: Sale of hazard and uncertainty

Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade the sale of hazard. And Zayd ibn Ali said: Selling what is in the belly of a slave girl is hazard, and selling what is in the bellies of livestock is hazard, and selling what livestock carry is hazard, and selling what palms bear this year is hazard, and selling the diver's stroke is hazard, and selling what the fisherman's net brings out is hazard. Zayd ibn Ali said: If he buys a fish in something that was taken without hunting, the purchase is permissible. And if it can only be taken by hunting, then it is hazard.
